main.name: William Jarvis-Cross
main.bio: Hi! I am a fourth year undergraduate student at the University of Toronto, and I am completing a double major in Computer Science and Astronomy and Astrophysics as well as a minor in Mathematics. Currently I work for Super (previously Snapcommerce), a commerce company dedicated to cater towards those left behind by credit companies. Outside of my studies, I enjoy learning about the intricacies of our Universe and staying physically active by playing various sports with friends.
main.contactmessage: Please feel free to contact me here.

education.description: Graduating in 2024 with a double major in Computer Science and Astronomy and Astrophysics as well as a minor in Mathematics.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Developed features for new and current products along with conducted experiments to efficiently improve the business. Used JavaScript React, Node.js and Python.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Heavily involved in designing software for Geopogo including augmented reality and general game features. Did front-end and back-end work mostly using Unity and C#.

projects.title: Pokemon Game
projects.description: This is my favourite personal project. This is a Pokemon game where the user can explore the world defeating randomly spawning pokemon or catching them to involve them in your team. Build up and train your team to prepare for the boss gyms.

projects.title: Infinity Dungeons
projects.description: Fun adventure game with many different dungeons to explore and defeat.

projects.title: Tron Heroes
projects.description: This is a 2 player game where the goal is to cut off your opponent while staying alive yourself.

projects.title: Sudoku Solver
projects.description: This is a simple python program that solves sudoku puzzles using a backtracking algorithm. Either input your own puzzle or use the random puzzle maker function.
